p:
The initial report on the first 41 cases of the COVID-19 outbreak showed that most patients infected with COVID-19 were males [30 [(73%) of 41], with less than half possessing underlying comorbidities [13 (32%)] which included diabetes, hypertension and cardiovascular disease.
3 The median age of cases was 49.0 years (Inter Quartile Range 41.0–58.0). Of the initial 41 patients infected, 27 (66%) had been directly exposed to the Huanan seafood market and the CFR was nearly 2%.
3 The CFR has remained at 2% since the start of the epidemic.
